sense.name: a prankster, a joker
sense.examples: John was a big tease and always played pranks on his brother. Her uncle was the family tease and famous for his practical jokes.

sense.name: a sexual tempter, usually a woman
sense.examples: She was a just a tease who distracted all the men at work. Jane discovered Bob was kind of a tease and didn't really want to get involved.

sense.name: the act of pranking or kidding someone
sense.examples: John couldn't resist a gentle tease when his wife asked him if he remembered to bring the tickets. The child endured the constant teases of his classmates.

sense.name: the act of sexually tempting someone
sense.examples: The club features a nightly strip tease by an exotic dancer. The new hire's blatant tease of the boss infuriated the other office workers.
